synthesis_conditions.seeding: seeded with previously grown small crystals
time: next day, blossoms of thin yellow needles appeared
after three more days, they were isolated
synthesis_conditions.notes: This procedure is a slight modification of a procedure published earlier. The less concentrated reactants used here yielded a better crystalline product. If the crystals of the α-phase are not isolated from the mother liquor in approximately 5 days after preparing the solution, the luminescent crystals of the β-phase start precipitating as well, thus contaminating the desired nonluminescent product. The mother liquor left standing for several days either at room temperature or at an elevated temperature (55 °C) produced block-shaped crystals of the β-phase.

synthesis_conditions.yield: large (up to 3 mm), block-like crystals, stable in air over a long period of time
time: next day, tiny luminescent cube-like crystals appeared on the walls of the beaker and on the bottom
after 10 days, this procedure yielded large crystals
synthesis_conditions.notes: No nonluminescent needles of α-UPP were observed in the beaker. For a single-crystal analysis, small crystals were isolated after only about 2 days.
